content.content: There is a quite interesting idea that I would like to share with you guys: Since we have so many discussions in the Discord governance channel, it’s quite hard to gather all the valuable opinions. In the morning, there was a dialogue between me and one of the community members. clipboard1368×1129 229 KB This inspired me with an idea came out of my mind: If you think your idea is valuable, why don’t prove it by burning 0.01ETH (send ETH to Burn address: 0x000000000000000000000000000000000000dEaD) with your opinion input in the txn data. Here is my: Delegate our votes to @rleshner (0x88FB3D509fC49B515BFEb04e23f53ba339563981) clipboard12269×1315 119 KB view the txns on Etherscan:https://etherscan.io/tx/0x50b1156d54b8613add1ce50d2f7437b33e7f445de210939fd6e67c4920f89b32 It’s a game, let’s have some fun!
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is explaining a proposal to gather valuable opinions in the Discord governance channel. The proposal involves burning 0.01ETH and inputting an opinion in the txn data. The author provides an example of their own opinion input and invites others to participate in the game. A 3rd party could give constructive criticism or ask questions about the proposal.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: I think it’d be much more worthwhile if you think your idea is valuable to burn your ETH by sending it to my wallet instead marko.argent.xyz …
or you should bet them in dice2win, If you are already burning them anyway, Why not take the chance?

I’m not sure burning ETH would be wise to prove a point. However, if you are in a Moloch DAO you can configure it so people have to pay a tribute to put a proposal in place. We’re actually tinkering with this right now to help governance discussion go forward. Feel free to come and test it !
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Support your ideas and ideas, I also appreciate it very much, hope it can be realized as soon as possible
